name: Pan-Fried Polenta with Bruschetta Topping
author: Michelle
summary: This yummy pan-fried polenta topped with fresh bruschetta topping makes great summer treat using fresh tomatoes and herbs!
ingredients: ⅓ cup diced oil-packed sundried tomatoes
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Line a pie pan with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray
Bring water to a boil in a pot over high heat
Add sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, and pepper
Reduce heat to low and let simmer until thick, about 10 minutes
Pour into the prepared pan; smooth out evenly
Chill in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours
Mix tomatoes, onion, basil, garlic, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper together in a bowl
Chill bruschetta until ready to use
Heat olive oil in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat
Remove polenta from the pie pan and slice into 8 triangles
Brown slices in hot oil until golden, about 6 minutes per side
Drain on paper towels; transfer to a serving plate
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and serve with bruschetta topping on each slice
